description:
Avoid drifting through 2010 and rediscover your sense of purpose


"Join us for a powerful, life-changing 2-day weekend seminar to enable you to create everything you want in 2010 and beyond."


Do you keep your New Year resolutions?
January is a period traditionally associated with New Year resolutions. So many people make New Year resolutions and that’s it. They never follow through on them and then find themselves the following January making the same resolutions again. And, so the cycle continues.

Getting back on course
Many people feel that the events of September 2008 pushed them way off course and 2009 is a year that most of us would probably prefer to forget. This intensive seminar will take you through a structured process for getting back on track to make 2010 your best year yet.

Are you planning to fail?
Most professionals recognize the need to have clear goals and to plan. The old saying: “Fail to plan, plan to fail” comes to mind. However, it’s often the one thing that professionals admit they don’t really do often enough. We will go beyond traditional goal setting and teach you how to create well-formed outcomes and action plans that really work.

Do you know where you are?
We chose the metaphor of a Compass because it is an instrument that is really good at letting you know where you’re at relative to where you want to go. However, often when a Compass comes into contact with certain substances that interfere with its workings, it needs to be reset.


Tried & tested for you

We have designed this seminar to ensure that:

• you get time to reflect on the things that are important to you in your life and begin to focus on the things you want more of
• you eliminate all obstacles from your past that prevent you from achieving your goals today
• you create the future that you know you can achieve
• you improve all your relationships
• you know how to achieve financial independence

At the end of this seminar you will have reconnected with your true purpose in life and have the tools, resources, motivation and confidence to achieve anything you set your mind to.

Early Bird Price: €495* (if registered and paid before 31st December 2009)

description:
Have you ever wondered where your motivation comes from?

One of the models which came out of the initial NLP research are the meta-programs.

Meta-programs are cognitive filters which explain how we make sense out of the world and how we motivate ourselves.  They describe the way individuals think, perceive and remember information or/and how they use such information to solve problems.  Meta-programs play a role in matching individuals to jobs, communication between team-members, organizational culture, etc.
  In this session you will learn:

-       how to recognize some meta-program distinctions;
-       how they apply in several contexts, such as work, relationships and education;
-       how to use them for coaching and motivation.

You can apply these skills immediately in both your private and professional life. You choose...

description:
"There are no unresourceful people, only unresourceful states"

Join us for our monthly NLP Practice group meeting when we will explore how to manage how you feel in any given situation in your life.

Why would you want to learn how to do this?

How you feel affects your body. It also impacts what you do and how well you do it. Ultimately, it determines the results you get in any given situation in your life.

Try this exercise...

Just picture for yourself now those situations when you didn't perform at your best or get the result you wanted. See what you saw. Hear what you said. Think of what you were doing. Notice how you feel just thinking about it!

What was the last thing you said to yourself before you got out of bed this morning?

Now picture those situations that went amazingly well and you got the results you wanted. See what you saw. Hear what you said. Think of what you were doing. Notice how you feel much better just thinking about them!

So, when you think about it, this also means that anyone who comes into contact with you will be affected by how you're feeling at that specific moment in time.

- Ever notice the impact a grumpy colleague can have on the atmosphere at work?

- Have you ever regretted getting angry or upset with someone, maybe a family member?

- Have you ever tried to get people excited about something and didn't succeed?

Therefore, being able to get yourself into the right state as opposed to a right state is a valuable skill to have. Even better, being able to get yourself out of a stuck state may even be more valuable. You can perform better and reduce stress, which always has health benefits.

The session will be led by NLP Trainer Gerry Murray

NLP Meetup topics are picked by the attendees at our events. So, if you want to have a session on something that interests you please come along to this workshop or send us a mail.

Organizations refer to work-life balance, we prefer to focus on life-work balance...

 

In this seminar we will explore leading edge perspectives on health and wellbeing. 

 

Much has been written about the Mind-Body connection and more and more scientific evidence exists that demonstrates the benefits of integrating mind and body in our quest for better health and wellbeing. 

 

Applying techniques from NLP, Hypnotherapy, Huna, Timeline Therapy, Medical Qi Gong, Reiki and practical experience working with people with health issues, you will be taken through a series of exercises that will enable you to experience your own mind-body connection. Some of the benefits you may discover:

 

- How to get a better night's sleep

name: Questions are the answer

description:
The famous American actress and sex symbol, Mae West, was once quoted as saying:

"I speak two languages, Body and English!"

Join us for a fun evening and learn how your body is communicating more than you think...

Numerous studies have demonstrated the importance of the non-verbal aspect of our communication. People are often stunned by just how much of what we communicate takes place out of our conscious awareness.

Body language literature has a tendency to over-generalize gestures and this is not useful in all contexts. In NLP we are taught to calibrate a range of non-verbal behavior without mind-reading what this may or may not mean for the other person. Therefore, we rely as much on the context as the words, gestures, etc. to enable us to establish meaning. This is particularly useful when working one-on-one with others in a coaching, mentoring or managing situation and dealing with groups of people.

Walking the talk...

 An area of particular interest is how to get leaders to walk their talk. Employees often perceive a mismatch between the words that leaders use and their subsequent actions. How can you make leaders more aware of their non-verbal behavior and teach them some ways to be more flexible and congruent in the messages they are sending out? Therefore, we will explore two ends of a spectrum: credible vs approachable and the non-verbals that typically accompany these.

Certain gestures will reliably create predictable responses when used in our daily informal communication or indeed in more formal communication settings such as giving a presentation. So, it can be important to know about these.

This seminar will be quite experimental in nature as we test out some new exercises that make us more aware of our own non-verbal behaviors. You should learn a lot about yourself...

description:
Do you feel  that you are getting in your own way from time to time? Do you have uncertainty, doubt or any discomfort in the same recurring situations? Do you sometimes feel overwhelmed by your nerves? Is it difficult for you to control your emotions? Are you frustrated about your own behavior or the situation where you are and you will succeed? The 3dMindTM Process is a self-application change tool that will allow you to take control of your own emotions so that you’ll be able to do the things that you want to do. 

The 3dMindTM Process was developed by Tom Vizzini and Kim McFarland, two communication specialists from Atlanta, Georgia. In collaboration with neuroscientists like Dr. Ken Guiffre and based on the work of renowned neuroscientists Joseph LeDoux and Mount Vernon Castle the 3dMindTM method was further refined.The 3dMindTM doesn’t rely on psychological theories or esoteric principles but is based on biological processes and the latest discoveries in neurosciences so the process became one of the most effective tools in personal change work. 

Also coaches, NLP practitioners and hypnotherapists from around the world begin to discover this method and use it in their practice, so they are better able to help their clients to breakthroughs. The 3dMindTM was developed in a way that everyone can quickly learn to use and apply it in their own life, even if you don’t have a background in self-development, NLP, Psychology, Hypnosis, …  

 

In this presentation you’ll discover:

How to get to the core of the problem without having to dig in your personal history or the necessity to relive traumatic memories in order to change things around How to neutralize limiting beliefs The secrets of motivation that most gurus do not understand Why affirmations do not work and how you can use them to create instant change. A quick overview of the inner workings of our brain that 99% of the coaches, hypnotherapists,  NLP practitioners and psychologists don’t  know about today How to change undesirable behavior, anxiety, procrastination, … around The truth about peak states and powerful resources  

Overview of presentation: 

History of the process What it’s used for and what outcomes you can expect Some basic underlying structures for the process The 3dMindTM Process Step by step  Exercises and examples Q&A   

What you can expect to get out of it: 

A great understanding of how to use the process in your own life.  Knowing that you can change yourself around using the 3dMind, without the need of for a professional change worker  You’ll learn how you can master your emotions and create lasting change.   

Bart Loos is a business mentor and founder of CoachesGettingClients.com, writer, NLP Master Practitioner & Certified 3dMindTM Practitioner. He trained with Robert Dilts, Deepak Chopra, Carl Van De Velde, Rudy Vandamme, Tom Vizzini & Kim McFarland, Paul Martinelli, Inge Rock, and many others.

Since the late '90s, he studied, practiced and mastered following methods ie: Primordial Sound Meditation, NLP, EFT, 3dMindTM, Donna Eden's Energy Medicine Work, Yoga, Tai Chi & Chi Kung and Silva Mind Control. 

He is a member of this Meetup group.

description:
An opportunity to experience Ericksonian Hypnosis with one of the leading practitioners in the field, Michael Perez.

Michael Perez will share insights from his two decades of working as an Ericksonian hypnotist doing in direct and conversational hypnosis in the context of therapy, performance coaching and training.


Michael will help you to understand how your brain works and how the way that we talk to people can influence their neurological function in profound and unexpected ways.


Michael will demonstrate hypnosis and will also teach you how to use your own language to be even more hypnotically persuasive and influential!


About Michael Perez
Michael Perez has been doing therapy and coaching, which he refers to as ‘changework’, for well over two decades.  Concurrently, Michael worked in the corporate arena doing IT, engineering, sales and management as well as doing modelling of top performers and their extraordinary skills and using those distinctions to develop and provide NLP-based communication, management and sales trainings within those organizations.


In his therapeutic and coaching work, Michael uses concepts from neurolinguistic programming (NLP), neo-Ericksonian hypnosis, cognitive linguistics and functional psychology. Michael has combined these things with aspects of his own research and is innovative approach to changework to create a unique (and uniquely effective) style of brief therapy and performance facilitation, aspects of which Michael has taught internationally.


Originally from the United States, Michael now resides in Belgium, routinely travels to the UK and other parts of Europe to work and train and engages with clients all over the world either via telephone or, more commonly, via voice-chat programs like Skype.


In addition to working with therapy and coaching clients, Michael trains students around the world in how to do hypnotic changework, has served as moderator and mentor on a number of popular advanced discussion forums for NLP practitioners and hypnotists and has published a number of books and videos on these subjects which have earned him the acclaim of his peers.

description:
Our plans miscarry because they have no aim. When a man does not know what harbour he is making for, no wind is the right wind. ~ Seneca

We kick off our NLP Meetups this year with a session on getting the most out of 2012.

Would you get into a taxi in Brussels and say to the taxi driver:

"Please take me anywhere…"

Sounds funny, yet many people live their lives in the back of that same taxi and allow it to take them just about anywhere. Life becomes one great big reactive circle, and the meter is constantly running up a large bill! I'm sure you'd agree that telling the taxi driver precisely where you want to get to is a much more effective and efficient strategy.

Reset your compass

By now you'll either be full-steam ahead with your new year's resolutions or you may not have got started yet. Wherever you are, this Meetup seminar is for you.

You can think of it as an opportunity to reset your compass. This means you start from wherever you are now... we'll guide you on how to get to where you want to be.

What we'll do...

Through many years of modeling excellence NLP has produced several great tools for ensuring that you get more of what you want in your life. In this session we'll go through together a process of applying many of these tools to enable you to make 2012 your best year yet!

Your unique opportunity to take some reflective time out and do some planning… and it's FREE!

Strictly limited to the first 15 people who sign up...

"NLP succeeds where traditional training fails to deliver because it works at a much deeper level of values, beliefs and identity and offers a myriad of tools and techniques for fast and effective change. NLP was not created for academic study or intellectual analysis. To know NLP is to short change yourself if you are not skilled enough to use it. To talk about NLP is still missing the point – you can only discover its power by trying it out. So the next time you catch yourself talking about NLP, stop. Practise what it is you are talking about and see how this changes your experience. That’s what NLP was designed for – to give you choice and control over your life experiences – to be at cause rather than effect." ~ David Molden, Best-selling NLP Author and Trainer

 

In effect, in every day use, learning has come to be synonymous with "taking in information". "Yes, I learned all about that at the training yesterday". Yet, taking in information is only distantly related to real learning. It would be nonsensical to say: "I just read a great book about bicycle riding-I've now learned that". ~ Peter Senge, The Fifth Discipline
name: NLP Practitioner 2012 - Part 1

description:
Learning should be fun, easy and effective!

NLP grew out of modeling excellence, particularly in the 3 inter-related disciplines of communication, learning and change. 

Join us for an exploratory evening where we will test out some of these early NLP models that have enabled thousands of people to improve their learning. 

One of the models we'll try on is the NLP Spelling Strategy. I know from personal experience that this model not only will enable someone with spelling difficulties to improve their spelling it can have a transformative effect on how they learn.

Here's how I know...

My 2nd daughter, Hannah, was told by her English teacher when she was 7 that she was mildly dyslexic - I'll explain why applying this label to a child of 7 can seriously handicap that child's learning abilities for the rest of their life! Whilst most of the kids in her class were getting 20 words to spell each week Hannah was only getting 10 words. Moreover, she was only getting 2 or 3 out of 10 correct on each test. Her overall grades on most subjects fluctuated between C+ and B.

So, one Sunday afternoon in preparation for her spelling test on the following Wednesday I taught her the NLP Spelling Strategy. Within one hour she could spell all 10 words correctly. On the Wednesday she scored 10/10 in her test. We repeated the Spelling Strategy each Sunday for the next few weeks and she repeatedly scored 10/10 on the subsequent tests.

Within a year Hannah was looking forward to the annual spellathon of +/-150 words and got nearly all of them correct. The most remarkable thing was that her grades across all subjects went up to a range of B to A!

 

We'll also test out strategies for remembering people's names, etc..

So, if you're really curious about the power of NLP to change lives and want to learn more then this is one seminar that you'll want to attend...

name: Learning Strategies

description:
An overview of organizational change and how to communicate this.

 

Why should you attend?

You want something to be different but don't know how to begin You believe you need to make some mindset changes at work and are not sure where to start You want to improve how you communicate change You're planning some changes in your department/division and need a better process Your organization is going through a change process right now and you want a better understanding of what's involved and how to deal with it You want to understand the impact that new tools/processes such as social media can have on organizations You want to learn something new  

What will we cover?

You will be introduced to change management methodologies and we'll explore the role of mindset and thinking styles in effecting change. We will demonstrate how to influence these, how to engage people in the change process and explore the role of leaders.

You will be introduced to a change toolbox that shows how leaders and communicators play an important role in communicating change. Taking this further you will focus on the specific language of change and it's impact on success or failure.

We will demonstrate how to apply a range of NLP-based tools and concepts that really produce results.

The workshop is accompanied by a Pre-Workshop Booklet and Audio Program

 

How will we do it?

The session will be highly interactive and participatory and you'll get to do some learning exercises. We use the 4-Mat system for each 90 minute segment:

Why are you doing this segment? What is the theoretical basis of this segment? How do you acquire these skills? Exercises. What if you apply this learning afterwards? Q&A The 4-Mat system ensures that all preferred learning styles are catered for.

 

What if you attend?

You'll leave better equipped to deal with your next change challenge.

 

Who will present this seminar?

Gerry Murray runs the change leadership consultancy Wide Circle and advises organizations on how to improve how they manage communication, learning and change. He is an NLP Master Practitioner and Coach, and an internationally accredited Trainer of NLP and related disciplines. He is passionate about learning and development and people achieving their full potential.

Gerry has a degree in Linguistics and French, is a Chartered Marketer and has an MBA in General Management. In the past 5 years he has trained thousands of people in how to improve their communication skills, learn more effectively and deal with change.

www.gerrymurray.com

 

Bryce Redford is Director of Change & Coaching at Wide Circle. He has an MBA in International Business, International Marketing and Change Management and over 20 years business experience leading and managing change and he is the first certified NLP Coach Trainer in Europe.

He has a passion for assisting people understand the important distinctions and subtle nuances in communicating [across different media and methods] and enabling them to communicate clearer and with greater volition.

description:
All coaching is, is taking a player where he can't take himself.
~ Bill McCartney

 

Imagine what you would see, hear and feel when you have the skills to free yourself from any limitations in your life.

Imagine you can work with others to enable them to unlock their true full potential.

Imagine being able to create things the way you want them in all areas of your life…


In this highly competitive and fast-moving business environment personal and business coaching has become an important part of many leaders' life and career. Being able to help outstanding professionals to maintain and enhance their work performance and life quality is one of the top-wanted qualifications and one of the most rewarding skills a coach can possess.

Many NLP Practitioner programs give you the elements of a coaching toolkit. Few teach you how to use it consistently to produce lasting results.

We offer all existing NLP Practitioners a unique opportunity to obtain these qualifications and skills by exploring Time Line Therapy® and mastering NLP Coaching Practitioner skills with certified Master Time Line Therapy® and NLP Coach Trainer Bryce Redford.

___________________________________________________

What will we cover?

___________________________________________________

 

Time Line Therapy® (31st March - 1st April)

On the first 2 days you will learn the advanced techniques of Time Line / Creating Your Future Coaching Techniques.

Time Line Therapy® is the latest development in NLP, created by Dr. Tad James and it utilizes a person’s own internal “TimeLine” to work with their unconscious minds in a variety of ways; including, healing emotional traumas and eradicating unwanted thoughts, emotions and behaviors.

Our life experiences and the memories associated with them impact on how we approach our lives now. Time Line Therapy® techniques enable you to eliminate many types of issues in your past, thus allowing you to move forward toward your goals and desires.

Techniques learned at this training not only will enhance your personal life quality and professional excellence, but also will increase your effectiveness working with others and your ability to empower yourself for optimum results.


NLP Coaching Practitioner (27th - 28th April)

NLP not only equips you with powerful self-development tools and techniques, but also helps to enhance your professional performance.

At this part of training you will learn how to create advanced coaching strategies by combining all your NLP skills and knowledge and Time Line Therapy® techniques.

NLP Coaching Practitioner Skills can be widely applied in:

- Business and Personal Coaching
- Sales, Marketing and Communication
- Learning and Educational Coaching
- Therapy and Relationship Coaching
- Other

___________________________________________________

Course Preparation

___________________________________________________

 

The full course is accompanied with 2 training manuals and a short audio program to enable you to prepare for the onsite training.

You will undertake a coaching assignment between the first and the second session.

___________________________________________________

What if you attend?

___________________________________________________


You will develop the skills and capabilities to consistently achieve more of what you want in your life and work and less of what you don't want and enable others to do the same.

You will find out the three things that can stop you achieving your goals and what you can do about them.

You will discover the secrets of motivation for yourself and others.

You will explore how these skills can enhance your capabilities in all areas of your life and business.

You will learn how to identify and clear interference that comes between capability and performance.

___________________________________________________

Certification:

___________________________________________________


NLP Coach and Secrets of Creating Your Future Coaching Techniques (Timeline Therapy®).

Note that you cannot become a Certified NLP Coach without obtaining Secrets of Creating Your Future Coaching Techniques (Timeline Therapy®) certificate.

All certificates are awarded by the American Board of NLP (ABNLP).

___________________________________________________

Trainers:

___________________________________________________

 

Bryce Redford is Director of Change & Coaching at Wide Circle. He has an MBA in International Business, International Marketing and Change Management and over 20 years business experience leading and managing change and he is the first certified NLP Coach Trainer in Europe.

Bryce trained as a facilitator and high performance coach to enhance his skills in project management and change. Still, he found there was something missing from traditional coaching which led him to discovering & exploring what NLP could offer. This took his coaching to a new level, supporting individuals he works with taking their performance beyond what they had previously thought possible.

Bryce continued the journey of exploring and training in NLP – becoming a trainer of NLP and Hypnosis (David Shephard), Timeline Therapy® and NLP Coach Trainer (Tad James – developer of Timeline Therapy®). Moreover, he has studied Master Coaching with Joseph O'Connor - one of the most respected individuals in the field of NLP Coaching.

Bryce utilizes his extensive NLP knowledge and experience in both executive and team coaching.


Gerry Murray runs the change leadership consultancy Wide Circle and advises organizations on how to improve how they manage communication, learning and change.

He is a Master Practitioner (certified by John Grinder) and a Certified Trainer of NLP, an Instructor of Hypnotherapy and holds Master Practitioner Certificates in TimeLine Therapy® and NLP Coaching.

He has studied/trained under many of the leading thinkers and developers in the field, including: Richard Bandler, Robert Dilts, Judith DeLozier, Joseph O’Connor, Charles Faulkner, Judith Lowe, David Shephard, Cricket Kemp, John Seymour, Stephen Gilligan, Shelle Rose Charvet, David Molden….

Gerry is passionate about learning and development and people achieving their full potential.

description:
One of the people that John Grinder and Richard Bandler modeled in the early development of NLP was Milton H Erickson, the founding President for the American Society of Clinical Hypnosis. This modeling project produced one of the most powerful NLP language models, The Milton Model. Hypnotic language patterns are the dominant form of communication in most organizations. CEO's are highly skilled at these as are trade union leaders and politicians.

Hypnotic states, also known as trance or altered states, are frequently misunderstood and there are many myths and untruths about Hypnosis. Few people realize that they go into a hypnotic state about every 20 minutes and this is often referred to as Day Dreaming. Others go into the TV trance, whilst watching TV - ever tried to get someone's attention when they are "glued" to the television?! In fact, hypnotic states are perfectly natural and a necessary way for us to get through our daily activities.

Join Antonia Harrison for a short seminar on April 26th and explore the myths and truth of hypnosis.

Hypnosis can help you bring positive change to your life using the unlimited power of your own unconscious mind whether you want to give up an unwanted habit e.g. smoking, nail-biting, stuttering, overcome a limiting fear or phobia e.g. heights, flying, spiders or that most terrifying of all: fear of public speaking! Maybe you do not have a problem but would like to experience life on an even better level e.g. more confidence, improved self-esteem, play better sport, learn foreign languages faster, develop more motivation… the list goes on including improved relationships and sex life.

Antonia Harrison brings positive change to people´s lives using the powerful tools of hypnosis and NLP with aspects of Ericksonian hypnosis and Time Line Therapy. She has a high success rate of helping anyone to stop smoking in one session, overcome fears and phobias, increase confidence and self-esteem and much more including allergies and certain health complaints. From April 2012 she will offer the Virtual Gastric Band Hypnotherapy for losing weight. She is an avid Toastmaster and assists clients to overcome any fear of public speaking. She works with adults and children over 7 years.

Antonia trained with The National College of Hypnosis & Psychotherapy and later became an NLP Master Practitioner. She is the only full-time Clinical Hypnotherapist in Belgium. She is currently writing a personal development book and hosts blogs on Hypnotherapy, Personal Development, The Law of Attraction, Stop Smoking and Weight Loss. Originally from London, she lives with her two sons in Limburg, Belgium and receives clients in Belgium, Spain and the UK.

www.antoniaharrison.com

description:
Is there something you'd like to change in your life right now and you still haven't found a way to do it yet?

You could be looking for a new direction, been talking to friends about it and feeling that things are not working out for you the way you want. You may even have started doing some new things to get from where you are to where you want to be and this is not producing the results you would like... just yet.

In safe hands

Our Coaching Practitioners will soon be completing their NLP Coaching Certification training over 2 days: 27th-28th April. As their final exercise they will coach someone from a problem towards a solution. That someone could be you...

Each of your coaches is already a highly skilled NLP Practitioner and to date has accumulated many hours of coaching experience. The exercises will be supervised by Bryce Redford and Gerry Murray, both experienced Coaches, Master Practitioners and NLP Trainers. So, you'll be in safe hands throughout.

 

To avail of this unique opportunity and to learn more please sign up here. Each session will last between[masked] minutes and places are limited to the first 10 people who register.

 

Showing up

A key skill in NLP is being able to notice patterns. One pattern we've observed over the years is that many people who sign up for things and don't show up rarely show up for themselves either. When you don't show up for something you let yourself down first... When you don't show up for yourself (by breaking the promises you make to yourself) you sabotage your chances of having a better life...

If you're still wondering how coaching can help here's a quote from one of the world's greatest coaches...

Sometimes coaches can teach you new information, new strategies and skills, they show you how to get measureable results. Sometimes a Coach doesn’t even teach you something new, but reminds you of what you need to do at just the right moment, and they push you to do it.”

Tony Robbins – “Awaken the Giant Within”

"A relationship built on mutual trust is one of the most satisfying relationships possible" - Joseph O'Connor

Building relationships is fundamental to our professional and personal lives. In a professional capacity we are often called upon to influence others so we can achieve our outcomes. True cooperation and collaboration depends on strong relationships and mutual trust.

In her latest book, The Shift- The Future of Work is Already Here, London Business School Professor Lynda Gratton states: "…in a world that becomes more and more virtual - strong, diverse, emotional relationships cannot be taken for granted, they have to be shaped and crafted.

NLP provides a practical toolbox that anyone can use for developing relationships.

Join us for this short seminar exploring some of the ways in which trust is built and how it can be lost. You'll also test these skills that you can use in any aspect of your life, connecting with others and building lasting relationships over time.

Is this for me?

You may already have many trusting professional relationships and want to ensure that you can maintain and nurture them. You may have some relationships that don't seem to work because of an apparent lack of trust. We will help you explore what you can do to improve them. Whether you are speaking to an audience of 1 or 1000, your presentations skills are just as important as the information you are presenting. It always comes down to your ability as a presenter to connect with and engage the audience.

Join us on December 11th and learn some simple techniques and tools to enhance your stage presence.

description:
“A brand is no longer what we tell the consumer it is – it is what consumers tell each other it is.” - Scott Cook, co-founder Intuit

 

Learn how to apply NLP principles and tools to how you communicate using Social Media.


Earlier this year, IBM released its 2012 Global CEO Study, comprised of interviews with over 1700 CEOs worldwide. One of the study’s findings revealed that only 16% of CEOs currently participate in social media and for many CEOs, social media is also one of the least-utilized methods of customer engagement. For professional communicators, this can be a real challenge.

With all the social media hype you may have thoughts and feelings such as:

o Am I missing out on something valuable for my personal and career development?

o Do we really need social media in our organization?

o If I were to know, how could I convince key stakeholders such as my CEO of its value?

o Perhaps there are good reasons why we should not adopt social media

It seems to be all or nothing. However, some aspects of social media seem appropriate. How do I identify these and link to our business strategy?


What will you learn?
In this workshop you will:

o Assess whether social media can make a difference and support you in reaching your communication and business desired outcomes

o Learn how to develop achievable and measurable outcomes that increase the ROI of your social communication strategy, both internally and externally.

o Develop the business case for participating in the social web.

o Understand the cultural change implications and what learning support you need to develop so that social networking produces significant improvements in performance

o Discover what social media tools are available, what each tool can do for your organization, and how to choose the right tools for the right purpose

o Explore what it takes to create and integrate a social media strategy into your communications strategy

How will you learn this?
Boost Your Communications Strategy with Social Media is designed to help you better understand how using social media affects your organization and how you can boost your communications efforts to meet organizational goals.


You will do a series of practical exercises that will allow you to align your business strategy with your communication strategy and maximize the ROI of your communication efforts, both online and offline. Your learning will be supported by case studies and the latest research available.


A practical workbook complements this unique learning experience.
Your learning doesn’t stop after attending this event. You can take your new knowledge, tools and skills back to your organization and get your team involved in boosting your organizational communications strategy.


Is this for me?
o You’re a business leader looking to take performance to the next level

o You’re a senior communications professional who still hasn’t managed to convince your colleagues of the value of social media

o You’re about to introduce social media into your organization and want to ensure that you get it right.

What if I attend?

o You are able to define whether your organization should use social media

o You have a clear understanding of how social media and social networking can be integrated in your communication strategy and the effort required

o You are able to plan, implement and evaluate meaningful social communication campaigns that support you reaching your business goals

o You have a practical roadmap on what aspects of social media fit into your communications strategy and how to go about “selling” this to your CEO.

o You know what benefits the social web can bring to your company and how to make the best of it in order to reach maximum performance

o Your impact, brand image and reputation are enhanced

 

This learning experience is designed and delivered by:

Radu Seuche is the Learning and Leadership Development Director at Wide Circle. Being part of Generation Y and growing up with the social web, Radu delivers workshops all over Europe to enable communicators and organizational leaders to get their vision and message across in the most effective way. He has recently returned from trips to Georgia, Moldova and Switzerland where he organized and delivered workshops related to the use of social media in areas spanning from business growth and development to participation and democracy.


Anete Lejiete is the Marketing Manager at Wide Circle, where she has daily hands-on experience of using Social Media tools to feed broader Communications Strategies. With an academic background in marketing management, she is passionate about using social networks and web power to enhance the effectiveness of marketing communications. Anete believes in building quality relationships by using the right communication tools for the right audiences to achieve the right results.

description:
“The human brain starts working the moment you are born and never stops until you stand up to speak in public.” – George Jessel


Imagine… after months of hard work you have just completed a successful project. Your boss comes into your office, congratulates you on your work and asks you to join him at a Board of Directors meeting to present your work as an example of best practice for the other departments. The meeting is in 15 minutes…are you ready?


Being a skilled public speaker today is a pre-requisite for leadership roles. If you’re still on your way to becoming a leader it enables you to increase your professional visibility. It positions you as a reliable spokesperson and advocate for your company at conferences and trade fairs, and enables you to successfully represent yourself and your team when engaging with colleagues. In many cases, it demonstrates your leadership potential because you need to get everyone on board and get things done.

Being able to successfully connect, engage with and inspire people enhances all areas of your life. It increases your general confidence and improves your day-to-day work, whether you are managing a team, leading a project, dealing with clients or trying to boost your company’s sales and marketing targets.


Mastering Public Speaking is a module on our Leading into the Future leadership development program. This training program applies the core principles and tools of NLP for achieving success.



What will you learn?
As a leader or someone with leadership potential, Mastering Public Speaking could be the best career-enhancing move you will ever make. In this unique program you will learn:

How to create great stage presence and connect with an audience
• Be calm, centered and confident
• Achieve a full awareness of audience, time and space
• Connect with your audience and keep the connection
• Manage group energy
• Be authentic and make a great first impression
• Master verbal and non-verbal communication tools and techniques.

How to engage an audience
• Captivate your audience and hold its attention
• Move your audience from one state to another
• Clearly communicate your message
• Transmit your passion to the audience
• Build and use stories and metaphors
• Structure a presentation utilizing different learning styles
• Be flexible whilst maintaining your key idea and structure
• Develop your skills in verbal and nonverbal communication.

How to make your finish memorable and inspiring
• Ensure you’ve gotten your message across
• Inspire your audiences
• Motivate your audiences to take action.

How will you learn this?
At Wide Circle we believe in creating meaningful learning experiences for the people we work with. This unique approach has four main aspects: performance coaching sessions, home-study materials, face-to-face training and personal assessments.


1. When beginning any journey it’s useful to know where you’re starting. Our profiling tools provide you with an insight into aspects of your thinking, learning and motivational preferences that will enable you to get the most out of this program.

2. Your initial performance coaching session helps you clarify the results you want and how public speaking will be a valuable skill in achieving them. It also introduces you to the home-study kit.

3. Your home-study kit contains audio/visual material and a workbook. It enables you to familiarize yourself with basic concepts, tools and techniques and work through some pre-classroom exercises. You then use the classroom training to develop and apply your skills and explore them in greater depth. The additional benefit of a home study kit is that you can refer to it after the classroom training to revise and perfect what you know.

4. The classroom training part is an interactive experience that combines theory with practical exercises. All learning styles are catered for guaranteeing that you’ll find it easy to learn. Skills are taught in layers with each layer building on the previous one. Therefore, you create a solid foundation during the first day on which you develop your skills. You will be able to experience the immediate difference in your performance as a speaker/presenter.

5. The second performance coaching session enables you to integrate what you have learned and map out your goals for the future.



What do you stand to lose?
• Despite your excellent work you’re not seen as a “safe pair of hands” or leadership material to let loose on the public
• Your promotional prospects are reduced
• You keep on giving variable performances when you speak – sometimes you get it right and sometimes you get it horribly wrong
• Your public performances have a negative impact on your organization’s brand
• Your public performances have a negative impact on your personal reputation

<strong style="color : #993300">What do you stand to gain?

• You will have the confidence and skills to present on any occasion to any audience
• You will have the tools, techniques and skills you need to be an inspiring presenter.
• You will know how to consciously create a strong stage presence, to convey your message in a compelling way and to inspire audiences to take action
• You will become an important extension of your organization’s brand
• You will be able to maximize your professional visibility and open up new career opportunities.


Join us and become the presenter you’ve always wanted to be.


This learning experience is developed and delivered by:

Gerry Murray, Founder & CEO of Wide Circle. With over 25 years of international business experience, he combines his expertise as an NLP Trainer and Master Coach with what he has learned as a musician performing in theaters worldwide, to teach people how to bring their public speaking to the next level.

Radu Seuche, Learning and Leadership Development Director of Wide Circle. Radu is an NLP Coach and enjoys being on the stage as a presenter. His experience involves international activities and trainings carried out at national, European, and worldwide level with different NGOs, companies and institutions.

Discover practical ways to increase trust and team spirit Learn how to foster collaboration and creativity Find ways to boost motivation and momentum in groups Inspire your team to achieving results consistently Learn the principles on how to align your team with company vision and values Gain a robust toolkit of teambuilding tips and techniques

description:
"Tension is who you think you should be. Relaxation is who you are." ~ Chinese Proverb

"How much pain they have cost us, the evils which have never happened." ~ Thomas Jefferson

Everyone has some stress in their lives. But very few people have the skills to deal with it. And, it's not taught in school!

An astonishing 50% of the reasons why people go to the doctor are stress-related.

We seem to hear daily of someone who has just taken medical leave because of a burnout or extreme stress. You may even be experiencing some of the symptoms yourself.

There is an un-useful myth that stress is somehow good for you! People actually believe that they can't do something unless they're stressed. They think they might lose their edge. If it is so good for you why is stress the biggest cause of workplace illness?

Stress and burnout impact on both individual, team and organisation performance.

Why attend this series of workshops?

As you learn to control your stress and eliminate unnecessary worry in your life and relax more, you will have more energy, become more efficient, more effective and your levels of happiness will improve. As you learn to change your response to stress and worry, you will be able to stay at your best for longer and bounce back quicker than ever before.

And, you'll start to look younger!

 

What will we do?

During 3 sessions in April, May, June:

We'll explore the common causes of stress You'll learn how to re-interpret the causes of your stress You'll identify resources that you can draw on in times of stress and learn how to re-activate your body's natural stress-reduction system  

How will we do this?

Through a combination of discussion and a series of exercises you'll test out some effective tools and techniques for dealing with and managing stress in your life. You'll also get a self-relaxation audio program that you can use at any time to relax.

 

What if I attend?

You'll be more aware of how stress occurs in your life and be able to respond to it in a resourceful way. You'll still have your full dynamic range of emotions and be able to respond appropriately to any situation. As you begin to learn to relax you'll begin to notice the amount of tension that you've been carrying around with you all this time. You'll have a toolkit and resources that you know work and that you can use at any time to manage and balance your stress response.

 

What if I don't attend?

You may find that your stress worsens. Among the many health issues to which stress is linked, a weakened immune system is likely to be the most noticeable. Typical symptoms can be: bad moods, loss of your sense of humour, headaches, bumping into things, making silly mistakes leading even to depression, anxiety and physical illness.

It's better if you can attend all 3 sessions to get the full benefit. However, if you cannot attend some of them you'll still benefit from the ones you do attend.

 

Important information

Sign in: 18:00

Start: 18:30

End: 21:00

Socializing: 21:00 onwards

The room sizes limits the number of participants we can accommodate. Therefore, to secure and guarantee your place please RSVP on this Meetup group and then register and pay here.

Price: €30 per session. €75 for all 3 sessions.

Your facilitator:

Gerry Murray is the founder and CEO of Wide Circle and an internationally certified NLP Trainer, Master Coach, Master Practitioner of Timeline Therapy® and an Instructor of Hypnosis. He works with leaders, teams and organisations to enable them to improve performance.

description:
Several members of this group have requested that we offer traditional NLP Practice group sessions. NLP Practice groups were at the heart of how NLP was developed in its early years.

Essentially, they provide an opportunity for NLP Practitioners and Master Practitioners to explore and practice the tools of NLP with others of similar knowledge and skill. It's also a chance to revise and update your skills and learn new things by modelling others...

So, if you're a certified NLP Practitioner or Master Practitioner please come along and join us for a fun evening of exploration, experimentation and acting 'As If'!

States of Excellence

In this first session we'll explore States of Excellence. For you to be effective as an NLP Practitioner you need to be able to choose your state at any time. Resourceful states tend to work best for most people and are necessary if you're going to work with others. This is a pre-requisite for congruence and ecology.

States are infectious. Therefore, being able to choose your state can have a profound impact on those around you. So, if you find yourself or others being occasionally "emotionally highjacked" and want to do something about it then you'll probably find this practice group useful.

We ask a small fee to cover some refreshments and other admin costs.

You can always invite other qualified NLP'ers in your network.

Logistics

Sign In: 18:00

description:
"Tension is who you think you should be. Relaxation is who you are." ~ Chinese Proverb

"How much pain they have cost us, the evils which have never happened." ~ Thomas Jefferson

 

Everyone has some stress in their lives. But very few people have the skills to deal with it. And, it's not taught in school!

An astonishing 50% of the reasons why people go to the doctor are stress-related.

We seem to hear daily of someone who has just taken medical leave because of a burnout or extreme stress. You may even be experiencing some of the symptoms yourself.

There is an un-useful myth that stress is somehow good for you! People actually believe that they can't do something unless they're stressed. They think they might lose their edge. If it is so good for you why is stress the biggest cause of workplace illness?

Stress and burnout impact on both individual, team and organisation performance.

 

Why attend this series of workshops?

As you learn to control your stress and eliminate unnecessary worry in your life and relax more, you will have more energy, become more efficient, more effective and your levels ofhappiness will improve. As you learn to change your response to stress and worry, you will be able to stay at your best for longer and bounce back quicker than ever before.

And, you'll start to look younger!

 

What will we do?

We'll explore the common causes of stress You'll learn how to re-interpret the causes of your stress You'll identify resources that you can draw on in times of stress and learn how to re-activate your body's natural stress-reduction system  

How will we do this?

Through a combination of discussion and a series of exercises you'll test out some effective tools and techniques for dealing with and managing stress in your life. You'll also get a self-relaxation audio program that you can use at any time to relax.

 

What if I attend?

You'll be more aware of how stress occurs in your life and be able to respond to it in a resourceful way. You'll still have your full dynamic range of emotions and be able to respond appropriately to any situation. As you begin to learn to relax you'll begin to notice the amount of tension that you've been carrying around with you all this time. You'll have a toolkit and resources that you know work and that you can use at any time to manage and balance your stress response.

 

What if I don't attend?

You may find that your stress worsens. Among the many health issues to which stress is linked, a weakened immune system is likely to be the most noticeable. Typical symptoms can be: bad moods, loss of your sense of humour, headaches, bumping into things, making silly mistakes leading even to depression, anxiety and physical illness.

It's better if you can attend all 3 sessions to get the full benefit. However, if you cannot attend some of them you'll still benefit from the ones you do attend.

End: 21:00

The room sizes limits the number of participants we can accommodate. Therefore, to secure and guarantee your place please RSVP on this Meetup group and then register and pay here.

Your facilitator:

Gerry Murray is the founder and CEO of Wide Circle and an internationally certified NLP Trainer, Master Coach, Master Practitioner of Timeline Therapy® and an Instructor of Hypnosis. He works with leaders, teams and organisations to enable them to improve performance.

description:
Several members of this group have requested that we offer traditional NLP Practice group sessions. NLP Practice groups were at the heart of how NLP was developed in its early years.

Essentially, they provide an opportunity for NLP Practitioners and Master Practitioners to explore and practice the tools of NLP with others of similar knowledge and skill. It's also a chance to revise and update your skills and learn new things by modelling others...

Our first session was deemed a success by all who attended and you can see the ratings and comments by clicking on Past Meetups.

So, if you're a certified NLP Practitioner or Master Practitioner please come along and join us for a fun evening of exploration, experimentation and acting 'As If'!

Sub-modalities

In this second session we'll explore Sub-modalities.

Many people are aware of our five modalities or representation systems: Visual, Auditory, Kinesthetic, Olfactory, Gustatory (VAKOG). Indeed the awareness of sensory processing goes way back to Aristotle!

A significant breakthrough in NLP was the discovery that within these modalities we make important distinctions and that these distinctions are fundamental to the intensity of meaning we give events around us, memories, etc... These are known as sub-modalities.

Being able to recognise a person's sub-modalities is essential to better understanding that person. Identifying a client's or colleague's sub-modalities is an important skill in coaching and change work. Knowing someone's sub-modalities is very useful in influencing, persuasion, negotiation and sales.

There are many ways to learn how to do this and practice makes perfect...

We ask a small fee to cover some refreshments and other admin costs.

You can always invite other qualified NLP'ers in your network.

description:
"NLP could be the most important synthesis of knowledge about human communication to emerge since the explosion of humanistic psychology in the sixties." ~ Science Digest

In this FREE Discover NLP seminar our aim is to answer four very basic questions:

• Why do people choose to learn NLP?

• What is NLP? – an overview of the key principles and demonstration of some of the tools.

• How can you learn NLP? You get to do some exercises to find out.

• What can you do next?

Why do you want to learn NLP?

The answer to this question is quite personal. However, when you have the answer you will be better prepared to select the right NLP training for you.

Historically, there are four main reasons why you would want to learn NLP:

1.  Personal Development

2.  Develop more effective communication, influencing, negotiation and sales skills for working in business and organizations

3.  Add skills to your training/teaching/presenting career

4.  Add skills to your therapeutic/coaching career

In practice, most people train in NLP for more than one of these reasons. When you have identified your own reasons then you’ll know what level of NLP training you want to do.

What will you learn on the day?

• The answer to the question "What is NLP?" and how you can use it in everyday life.

• Discover how to build instant rapport with anyone, anywhere, and influence his or her behaviour. 

• How to read body language so that you can understand people better.

• How to instantly change your mood.

• The way the mind and brain works.  This knowledge will change how you communicate forever.

• Methods that make learning and memory retention easier.

• Why values are important and how they help you be better motivated and more persuasive.

• Understand the different ways people think.  

• Learn how to use these thought processes to dramatically increase your influencing skills.

• Creating Your Future Coaching techniques®. These techniques create the difference that makes the difference between achieving a goal or not.

• Learn how to use NLP to increase your fulfilment, freedom, and wealth.

• Witness and experience the power of NLP first hand.

How will you experience NLP on the day? 

It's important that NLP Practitioners be congruent and ecological in everything they do. In other words, they should be able to "walk their talk"! Therefore, we'll be using NLP processes and tools to teach NLP. This way you get a full immersion in the subject and will experience the benefits in many different ways. Then you can choose what works best for you. 

What if you attend?


We promise that you'll have a fun day of exploration and active learning and you'll know whether NLP is something for you, your colleagues or your organization to explore further.

Who is this for?

Anyone can learn and benefit from NLP. In business or organization life it's particularly important for Human Resource professionals, Sales people, Leaders and Managers to have NLP skills because they enable them to better connect and communicate with internal and external audiences. It also enables you to learn faster and better deal with change.

In life in general, NLP enables you to build more trusting, deeper relationships and have more influence.

Event Starts: 10:00

Lunch: 13:15-14:15

Event Finishes: 17:00


Price

This is a free event. The only thing we ask is that if you sign up you keep your commitment or let us know in advance if you cannot attend.

There will also be special offers available for the certified NLP Practitioner exclusively to those who attend this event. 

Your Presenter

Gerry Murray is an internationally certified NLP Trainer and Master Coach who has trained with most of the leading developers and teachers in the field including co-creators Richard Bandler and John Grinder. He is the Association for NLP's ambassador in Belgium and since 2008 has made it his mission to raise the profile, and promote the positive benefits, of NLP in Belgium and beyond.

description:
NLP Practice groups were at the heart of how NLP was developed in its early years.

Essentially, they provide an opportunity for NLP Practitioners and Master Practitioners to explore and practice the tools of NLP with others of similar knowledge and skill. It's also a chance to revise and update your skills and learn new things by modelling others...

So, if you're a certified NLP Practitioner or Master Practitioner please come along and join us for a fun evening of exploration, experimentation and acting 'As If'!

Strategies - the unconscious processes we use to create all our behavior

Being able to elicit strategies is at the core of NLP modelling. So, it's important to be really good at it. And, it seems it's not always the easiest part of NLP to learn. 

Join us for this interactive and experimental session where we explore how to get really exquisite at eliciting and utilizing strategies across contexts. This is what we'll cover:

• Learn how we do what we do

• Discover your own and other people’s decision-making strategy

• Understand the basis of NLP modeling

• Change your less useful strategies for more useful ones and use your effective strategies more often

description:
An easier and faster way to learn NLP and more

Especially for busy people, the most complete and flexible way to learn NLP by combining pre-study with classroom learning. Offered in English over 3 long weekends in Brussels this unique approach minimizes the amount of time you need to take out from work or family and eliminates the additional costs of traveling to an English-speaking country. 

What will I learn on the NLP Practitioner Certification program?

The underlying principles of NLP - the foundations of excellence

• A simple model of communication that will enable you to understand how others make sense of the world and to always get your message across

• Empowering beliefs that will change the way you experience and interact with the world around you

• Understand the mind and body as a system and how to take control of this

Well-formed Outcomes - the keys to getting what you want


• Ask questions that enable you to get totally clear about what you really want


• How to set goals so that you consistently achieve them

• How to enable others to get similar results

Rapport - the essence of connecting, persuasion and influence

• Quickly connect with others

• Discover the real secrets to body language

• Get people to unconsciously identify with you

• Use your voice to build rapport rapidly on the telephone

• Elegantly disagree with others whilst maintaining rapport

• Know how to get back in rapport when someone else breaks rapport with you

Representational Systems - how we use our senses


• Discover how we experience the world


• Learn to match another person’s preferred system to create rapport and deep understanding

• Discover how others are thinking

Submodalities - the finer distinctions of how we give meaning to things

• Learn how to use your brain’s programming language

• Discover how someone internally structures their reality and how to influence that

• Use submodalities to quickly change unwanted feelings, behaviors and habits

Language Patterns - how to use language with awareness, elegance and precision

• Use your language with volition to gain greater acceptance of your message

• Learn how to ask questions that get you the information you need with speed and precision

• Know the best question to get to the root of a problem

• How to overcome objections elegantly

• Learn powerful conversational techniques to assist someone in changing their mind

• Negotiate with elegance and quickly gain agreement on opposing points of view

Anchoring - how we’re influenced by associative conditioning

• Strengthen your personal resources and your ability to access them whenever and wherever you want

• Remove bad feelings from past experiences

• Create powerful resources to get people out of “stuck” states such as procrastination or confusion

Strategies - the unconscious processes we use to create all our behavior


• Learn how we do what we do


• Discover your own and other people’s decision-making strategy

• Understand the basis of NLP modeling

• Change your less useful strategies for more useful ones and use your effective strategies more often

Frames - how we derive meaning from our experiences

• Learn how our frames of reference affect our interpretation of events

• Discover how framing impacts our ability to understand things

• Learn how pre-framing enables you to deal with potential objections

• Expand your choices by becoming skilled at re-framing

• Resolve conflicts easily and quickly

• Become a skilled negotiator

• Help others find better ways of solving problems

Parts - the key to personal congruence

• Learn how to resolve internal conflicts


Timelines - get more of what you want in your life


• Understand how you process time


• Elicit your time line

• Change the direction and location of your time line

• Discover the root cause of your problems and how to solve them 

• Learn how to create your future the way you want it to be


How can I learn all this in just 7 days?


Before attending the live training you study from a specially produced Home Study program, which is included in the price of the training. We also provide you with a recommended reading list.

The pre-study takes about 70 hours, which you can do at your own convenience. During the live training you’ll learn the latest developments and distinctions and get to practice what you’ve learned. You’ll also get coaching during the exercises from our team of qualified coaching assistants.

Prior to attending the training you will receive a coaching call from a member of our team to check how you’re progressing with your pre-study.

Who will be leading the training?

The Practitioner training is led by Gerry Murray a highly experienced certified NLP trainer.

description:
Our plans miscarry because they have no aim. When a man does not know what harbour he is making for, no wind is the right wind.~ Seneca

For the 4th year in a row, we kick off the New Year with a FREE session on getting the most out of 2014. This has proven a very popular event in past years so we recommend you sign up early to secure your place. ;-)

No prior NLP knowledge or experience required.

Would you get into a taxi in Brussels and say to the taxi driver:

"Please take me anywhere…"

Sounds funny, yet many people live their lives in the back of that same taxi and allow it to take them just about anywhere. Life becomes one great big reactive circle, and the meter is constantly running up a large bill! I'm sure you'd agree that telling the taxi driver precisely where you want to get to is a much more effective and efficient strategy. To do this you first need to have an address...

Reset your compass

By the 11th January 2014 you'll either be full-steam ahead with your New Year's resolutions or you may not have got started yet. Wherever you are, this seminar is for you.

You can think of it as an opportunity to reset your compass. This means you start from wherever you are now... we'll guide you on how to get to where you want to be.

What we'll do...

Through many years of modeling excellence NLP has produced several great tools for ensuring that you get more of what you want in your life. In this session we'll go through together a structured process of applying many of these tools to enable you to make 2014 your best year yet!

Your unique opportunity to take some reflective time out and do some planning… and it's FREE!

Utilizing the Milton Model to induce trance

Learn how to use language with volition to enable others to access their deep resources, free themselves from stuck states and get more of what they want in life. 

The Milton Model was the 2nd main model created by Bandler & Grinder in the early days of NLP. So, come take a trance with us...

description:
This is another event in our Discover NLP series...

Give a person a fish and you feed them for a day. Teach them how to fish and you feed them for the rest of their life. 


In this Discover NLP seminar, we'll introduce how to apply NLP Tools & Time Line Therapy® in coaching. We'll also introduce Ericksonian Hypnosis as a further enhancement and deal with many of the myths and common misunderstandings of hypnosis and altered states of consciousness.

NLP Coaching

NLP Coaching goes beyond many other coaching methods in its ability to combine traditional coaching approaches with modelling excellence. It is highly generative and goes further than simply improving behaviours. Thus, for a client it involves two simultaneous outcomes: learning both what to do and how to do it. 

As an NLP coach your mission is to teach your clients how to fish for themselves by building self-awareness, empowering them to take responsibility for their own results and guiding them to access their own resources to be able to achieve what they want in life.

So, if you're curious about how to achieve this and what's in the NLP Coach's Toolbox this will be relevant to you.

Time Line Therapy®


Three simple things can often explain why we’re not getting what we want in life:

·  Ineffective strategies that produce variable results

·  Unresolved Negative Emotions from the Past

·  Limiting Beliefs in the Present

NLP can assist you with all three of these. Time Line Therapy® is the most effective, easiest and fastest way to deal with unresolved negative emotions and limiting beliefs. It is a valuable addition to a Coach's toolbox as often a client's ability to get benefits from coaching is severely restricted by not addressing these two aspects of their life. A typical example would be fear. Once all negative emotions and limiting beliefs have been cleaned up, the way is open for you and your clients to get more of what you want in life.

Ericksonian Hypnosis

Named after the renowned Hypnotherapist Milton Erickson, Ericksonian Hypnosis is an indirect permissive approach to hypnotherapy that enables a client to access altered or trance states for the purposes of improving communication with their unconscious resources. It can assist people in getting rid of unwanted habits such as smoking, dealing with dis-ease or installing new and more effective strategies for an improved life.

In developing NLP, Richard Bandler and John Grinder derived the Milton Model by modeling Milton Erickson's approach to trance work and his skill in using language, metaphor and non-verbal communication.

Is this seminar for me?

Yes. If you're interested in learning about NLP. If you're already a coach and want to explore how NLP can make you an even better coach. If you're a therapist and want to enhance your therapeutic skills. If you're an NLP Practitioner/Master Practitioner and you didn't do either Time Line Therapy® or Ericksonian Hypnosis are part of your training. Or, if you're simply curious...

How will we do this?

As always, we'll use NLP to teach NLP and will do some demonstrations and exercises.

description:
Do you sometimes feel as though you're drifting through life?

Do you sometimes think that you've not really reached your true potential?

Do you believe that you could be more fulfilled and motivated in some aspect of your life: work, relationships, health & fitness, finances, family?

Did you plan to change the world when you were 21 and have somehow not yet got started?

Do you feel stuck and not sure what to do next?

Whatever your reason, if you think you are missing something important in your life then this is the seminar for you...

What will you learn?

NLP is a collection of models of excellence. One of the most powerful and useful models is called Neurological Levels of Alignment for Learning & Change. It was developed by Robert Dilts, one of the most prolific developers in the field of NLP. It is an excellent model for aligning your life with your sense of purpose, regaining motivation and having more fun!

How will you learn this?

In this 1-Day seminar Gerry Murray will introduce you to NLP and take you through a series of exercises using the Neurological Levels model as a base to discover what really lights you up and motivates you and connects you to your sense of Purpose. All delivered with Gerry's lively and entertaining style...

What if you attend?

When you attend this life-changing seminar you'll come away with the answers to many of your unanswered questions and with a renewed sense of what it is you want in your life. 

Imagine achieving all that in a day - and it's free!

Is this the same as the last one?

No. This is a different Discover NLP seminar.

Do I need to be a Practitioner to attend?

No prior NLP knowledge is required and Practitioners are very welcome too.

Timelines - get more of what you want in your life 

• Understand how you process time 

• Elicit your time line

• Change the direction and location of your time line

• Discover the root cause of your problems and how to solve them 

• Learn how to create your future the way you want it to be 

How can I learn all this in just 7 days? 

Before attending the live training you study from a specially produced Home Study program, which is included in the price of the training. We also provide you with a recommended reading list.

The pre-study takes about 70 hours, which you can do at your own convenience. During the live training you’ll learn the latest developments and distinctions and get to practice what you’ve learned. You’ll also get coaching during the exercises from our team of qualified coaching assistants.

Prior to attending the training you will receive a coaching call from a member of our team to check how you’re progressing with your pre-study.

Who will be leading the training?

The Practitioner training is led by Gerry Murray a highly experienced certified NLP trainer.

description:
NLP Practice groups were at the heart of how NLP was developed in its early years.


Essentially, they provide an opportunity for NLP Practitioners and Master Practitioners to explore and practice the tools of NLP with others of similar knowledge and skill. It's also a chance to revise and update your skills and learn new things by modelling others...

So, if you're a certified NLP Practitioner or Master Practitioner please come along and join us for a fun evening of exploration, experimentation and acting 'As If'!

During this interactive workshop we'll explore how to elicit and utilize Meta Programs and how they can be used in a work related context both at an individual level (for coaching, training, motivation) and also at an organizational level (organizational culture etc.). 

Together with Peter Callens from Pantelco, we will discover iWAM - an online questionnaire that objectively measures how people process and use information through Meta Programs.

 

The Inventory for Work Attitude & Motivation (iWAM) is a questionnaire used for job-related activities, such as recruitment, coaching and training projects. It is based on metaprograms, a model of cognitive thinking styles (48 parameters are measured and explained). 

The iWAM Management Report identifies a person's motivational and attitude preferences in the job context and predicts how this person will behave in various job types, such as administrative, customer contact or managerial tasks. The iWAM Attitude Sorter predicts key motivational preferences and development areas.

description:
A date for your diary/agenda...

Many NLP Practitioner trainings do not offer formal training in Hypnotherapy. Yet, many of the linguistic patterns and core elements of NLP were derived from modelling one of the greatest hypnotherapists of all time, Milton Erickson.

Hypnotherapeutic techniques are a valuable addition to a coaching or therapy toolkit, particularly when you work with people on life or health issues. 

Learn how to use hypnotic patterns to help yourself and others make changes in your life. Apart from its therapeutic benefits, hypnosis when applied to self is invaluable for enabling you to relax more and stress less!

It's also fun!

Become certified as an Ericksonian Hypnosis Practitioner by the American Board of Hypnotherapy (ABH) in just 2 days. Please note that you must have an NLP Practitioner Certificate from a recognised certifying organisation to be able to attend. If in doubt, please contact us. 

What will you learn?

• The History of Hypnosis

• Fundamentals of Ericksonian Hypnosis

• Patterns of Indirect Suggestion

• The Preparation for Trance

• Stages of Hypnosis

• Suggestibility Tests

• Ericksonian Inductions

• General Hypnosis Paradigm

• The Pendulum Chart

• Deepening Techniques

• Contra-Indications for Hypnosis

• Post-Hypnotic Suggestions

How will you learn?

Hypnosis is taught using hypnosis so be prepared for a very trancy, relaxing weekend!

What if I learn Ericksonian Hypnosis?

When certified as an Ericksonian Hypnosis Practitioner you will be able to incorporate Hypnotherapy into your coaching or therapy work. You will also have a great knowledge and appreciation of how hypnosis and trance actually work and be able to dispel many of the myths surrounding it.

Gerry Murray is the founder and CEO of Wide Circle, an internationally certified NLP Trainer and NLP Master Coach and a certified Instructor of Hypnosis.

description:
"NLP could be the most important synthesis of knowledge about human communication to emerge since the explosion of humanistic psychology in the sixties." ~ Science Digest


NLP is increasingly popular in businesses, organisations and beyond... That's because it gets results!

Join us for this FREE seminar to discover how to apply NLP in the workplace so you too can get outstanding results in everything you.

Who's this seminar for?

If any of these apply then this seminar is for you:

• You're a manager or a leader and not getting consistent results from your teams

• You're an entrepreneur growing a business


• You've studied some NLP in the past and have never quite figured out how to apply it in the workplace

• You need to collaborate with others to get your job done

• You are in a specialised support function (HR, Communications, Change Project Management,) and want to enhance your toolkit

• You're a consultant or business coach and want to improve your knowledge of how NLP can help you become more effective


• You're thinking of getting certified as an NLP Practitioner/Master Practitioner/Coach and want to ensure it's going to be worth the investment

• You need some fresh inspiration!


"If you always do what you've always done, you'll always get what you've always got... and there's always more!"

What will we do?


We will take the core principles and models of NLP and explain how these can be applied at work. NLP is not a theory. It is a collection of models of excellence that work and draws on some theories to explain these. Therefore, the art and science of NLP lies in your ability to contextualise and apply it in everyday life. 

How will you learn?

We will provide some introductory audio files to listen to beforehand and a handout on the day. The rest will be a combination of demonstrations and short exercises so you get to see, hear and feel NLP at work. 

Above all, we emphasise learning by doing and having lots of fun! ;-)

No prior NLP knowledge or experience is required to attend this event.

What if you want to join us?
